activities.loc: Richland County Courtroom, Floor C, Courthouse

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kristopher M. Beatty

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
requesting remote appearance

Request to appear remotely has been approved by Judge McDougal.

1:04 PM 22CF106/22CF128 - Defendant Kristopher M. Beatty appeared by video.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Yang appears in person. Attorney Yang just received the complaints. KB hasn't received the complaint. Attorney Yang asks for a moment to meet with his client. KB speaks about bond. Court resets.

01:22 PM Same appearance. Max penalties stated. Attorney Yang waives the formal reading and enters a not guilty plea on the CM.

Attorney Yang address bond. Attorney Harper doesn't have an objection to convert 22CM128 bond to a signature bond. Court converts the 22CM128 bond to a $500 signature bond. 

Attorney Yang waives the time limits for a preliminary hearing. Court will set the next hearing as a waiver of the preliminary hearing and asks that Attorney Yang inform the court if a preliminary hearing is needed.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waiver of Prelim on September 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
